availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, soldier. Ohio native. Resident of Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served as captain and major in the 3rd Kentucky Cavalry from December 13, 1861 to 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Jamestown, p. 698.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 63.
Find A Grave, "Lewis Wolfley (Birth-Death)," Memorial #9747, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9747 (accessed July 2, 2019).
James E. Cook, “Territory chief founded paper to push views,” The Arizona Republic, 20 May 1990.
